TITLE: House GOP divided over whether McCarthy should give in on 'motion to vacate'
SUMMARY: The House Republican Conference is still entrenched in an internal war over whether to reinstate an arcane rule that would empower any member to bring up a vote to oust a speaker at any time.

TITLE: Exclusive: US finalizing plans to send Patriot missile defense system to Ukraine
SUMMARY: The Biden administration is finalizing plans to send the Patriot missile defense system to Ukraine that could be announced as soon as this week, according to two US officials and a senior administration official.

TITLE: Congress gears up to pass short-term funding extension as partisan battle lines harden over broader deal
SUMMARY: Lawmakers still have no agreement on new funding levels for a massive full-year spending bill, casting doubt over whether the issue will be resolved by the end of the year and calling into question whether lawmakers may be forced to fund government at the same level as last year or punt talks to January, when Republicans take control of the House and the future of the bill could be even more perilous.

TITLE: Los Angeles councilman will not resign amid audio scandal and scuffle with protester
SUMMARY: Days after video of a scuffle with an activist surfaced, and months after racist remarks on tape went viral, Los Angeles councilman Kevin de León tells CNN he will remain on the city council and is attending a scheduled meeting later Tuesday.

TITLE: John Lewis to be honored on US postage stamp next year
SUMMARY: The late civil rights trailblazer and congressman John Lewis will be honored on a new postage stamp in 2023, the US Postal Service announced Tuesday.

TITLE: Recount reconfirms GOP Rep. Lauren Boebert's victory in Colorado's 3rd District
SUMMARY: A recount reconfirmed that GOP Rep. Lauren Boebert defeated Democrat Adam Frisch in Colorado's 3rd Congressional District, the Colorado secretary of state said this week.

TITLE: Nevada, New Mexico and Georgia officials subpoenaed by DOJ for records related to 2020 election
SUMMARY: Local officials in Nevada, New Mexico and Georgia have received federal subpoenas for records related to the 2020 election as the Justice Department's investigation intensifies in battleground states.

TITLE: January 6 committee chairman: Final public meeting will be Monday and full report will come out December 21
SUMMARY: Rep. Bennie Thompson, the chairman of the House select committee investigating the January 6, 2021, insurrection, told reporters the committee will hold its final public meeting on Monday and that the panel's full report will come out December 21.

TITLE: Biden signs into law same-sex marriage bill
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden signed into law Tuesday landmark new federal protections for same-sex and interracial couples, capping both a personal and national evolution on an issue that's enjoyed growing acceptance over the past decade.

TITLE: DeSantis targets Covid vaccine manufacturers and CDC in latest anti-vaccine moves
SUMMARY: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis on Tuesday asked his state's Supreme Court to green-light an investigation of "any and all wrongdoing in Florida with respect to Covid-19 vaccines," his latest move to cast doubt on the vaccines' effectiveness and amplify fears about side effects.

TITLE: What is Title 42, and how does it to connect to what's happening now in El Paso?
SUMMARY: A growing number of migrants are crossing the border near El Paso, Texas, and statements from officials there are adding fuel to debate over the looming end of Title 42 -- and how authorities will respond.

TITLE: Top Energy Department official no longer employed after luggage theft accusations
SUMMARY: The Department of Energy official responsible for nuclear fuel and radioactive waste is no longer employed by the federal agency after two alleged airport baggage theft incidents, according to local reports and court records.

TITLE: DOJ charges 5 Russian and 2 US nationals with conspiring to violate sanctions by smuggling equipment to Russian military
SUMMARY: The US Justice Department has charged five Russian nationals and two US nationals for allegedly conspiring to violate US sanctions by smuggling US-made equipment to the Russian military, according to a recently unsealed indictment.

TITLE: Justice Department has tried to access GOP Rep. Scott Perry's text messages
SUMMARY: The Justice Department has tried to gain access to Republican Rep. Scott Perry's text messages as part of a criminal investigation into 2020 election interference, facing off with his lawyers in a secret court proceeding after seizing his phone, CNN observed at the courthouse and sources familiar with the investigation said.

TITLE: El Paso faced a 'major surge in illegal crossings' over the weekend, senior border official says
SUMMARY: More than 2,400 migrants crossed into the United States near El Paso, Texas, daily over the weekend, according to a senior Border Patrol official, marking what he described as a "major surge in illegal crossings" in the region.

TITLE: What is Title 42, and how does it connect to what's happening now in El Paso?
SUMMARY: A growing number of migrants are crossing the border near El Paso, Texas, and statements from officials there are adding fuel to debate over the looming end of Title 42 -- and how authorities will respond.

TITLE: Impeachment effort will only complicate the immigration puzzle
SUMMARY: Immigration, always simmering in the American political conversation, could take on new importance with a "surge" at the border, the end of Title 42, a doomed impeachment effort and the slim possibility of a bipartisan win before the year is done.

TITLE: First on CNN: Biden administration to pilot new portions of citizenship test next year
SUMMARY: The Biden administration plans to conduct a trial for portions of the naturalization exam, which immigrants must pass to become US citizens, next year, to try to make the test more accessible, US Citizenship and Immigration Services will announce Wednesday.

TITLE: Negotiators announce bipartisan framework agreement for government funding package
SUMMARY: Top congressional negotiators announced Tuesday evening that an agreement had been reached for a framework that should allow lawmakers to complete a sweeping full-year government funding package.

TITLE: McCarthy and McConnell on collision course
SUMMARY: House GOP Leader Kevin McCarthy took to Fox News primetime last week and dinged his counterpart across the Capitol: Senate GOP Leader Mitch McConnell.

TITLE: Los Angeles councilman will not resign amid audio scandal and scuffle with protester
SUMMARY: Days after video of a scuffle with an activist surfaced, and months after racist remarks on tape went viral, Los Angeles councilman Kevin de León told CNN he will remain on the city council but again faced protests at the council's scheduled meeting Tuesday.

TITLE: Trump Org. entities were held in criminal contempt and fined $4K ahead of tax fraud trial
SUMMARY: A Manhattan criminal court judge held entities of the Trump Organization in criminal contempt for not complying with multiple grand jury subpoenas dating as far back as October 2020 and three court orders mandating they produce the requested evidence ahead of their recent tax fraud trial.

TITLE: Exclusive: US finalizing plans to send Patriot missile defense system to Ukraine
SUMMARY: The Biden administration is finalizing plans to send the Patriot missile defense system to Ukraine that could be announced as soon as this week, according to two US officials and a senior administration official.

TITLE: McCarthy keeps making compromises that could weaken his speakership before he's even won it
SUMMARY: Political leaders are generally at their strongest the moment they take office.

TITLE: Joe Biden Fast Facts
SUMMARY: Joe Biden Fast Facts from CNN provide a look at the life of the president.

TITLE: Jon Corzine Fast Facts
SUMMARY: Read Fast Facts from CNN about Jon Corzine, former governor of New Jersey.

TITLE: First on CNN: Biden administration to pilot new portions of citizenship test next year
SUMMARY: The Biden administration plans to conduct a trial for portions of the naturalization exam, which immigrants must pass to become US citizens, next year, to try to make the test more accessible, US Citizenship and Immigration Services will announce Wednesday.

TITLE: There is a spending outline in Congress. Now what?
SUMMARY: Tuesday night's announcement that Senate and House negotiators secured an agreement on the omnibus spending bill framework is a big deal. With just a few legislative days to go before Christmas, aides and members were growing nervous that Congress was walking right up to the point of no return where there simply wasn't going to be enough time to pull this together before December 23.

TITLE: Biden administration prepares for surge of migrants ahead of the forced end of a Trump-era border policy
SUMMARY: As administration officials considered a border proposal reminiscent of the Trump era this month, Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer called Ron Klain, President Joe Biden's chief of staff, with concerns, according to three sources with knowledge of the call.

TITLE: McCarthy's impossible GOP math
SUMMARY: Political leaders are generally at their strongest the moment they take office.

TITLE: Biden welcomes African leaders for summit as China and Russia expand influence
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden welcomes nearly 50 leaders from Africa on Wednesday for a summit intended to reset Washington's commitment to a region where China and Russia are also working to expand their influence.

TITLE: Rand Paul Fast Facts
SUMMARY: Read Fast Facts from CNN about Rand Paul and learn more about the US senator from Kentucky.

TITLE: Ted Cruz Fast Facts
SUMMARY: Read CNN's Fast Facts about Ted Cruz and learn more about the Republican Senator from Texas and former 2016 presidential candidate.

TITLE: DeSantis targets Covid vaccine manufacturers and CDC in latest anti-vaccine moves
SUMMARY: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis on Tuesday asked his state's Supreme Court to green-light an investigation of "any and all wrongdoing in Florida with respect to Covid-19 vaccines," his latest move to cast doubt on the vaccines' effectiveness and amplify fears about side effects.

TITLE: What to know about a judicial privacy bill Congress is passing with a major defense package
SUMMARY: A bill that allows federal judges -- who have increasingly become targets of threats, violence and even assassination plots -- to shield certain personal information about them from public view is poised to finally become law.

TITLE: CNN Poll: Americans have little appetite for Biden-Trump rematch in 2024
SUMMARY: There's little appetite for a 2020 rematch in the coming presidential election, according to a new CNN Poll conducted by SSRS, as majorities of registered voters within each party say they'd rather see someone new nominated in 2024.

TITLE: As House January 6 committee winds down, it is abandoning efforts to subpoena phone records
SUMMARY: The House select committee investigating the Capitol riot is dropping several of its pursuits for January 6-related phone records, according to court filings this week, as the panel winds down before it expires at the end of this year.

TITLE: Club Q survivors blame GOP rhetoric for mass violence
SUMMARY: Survivors of the Club Q mass shooting directly tied Republicans' rhetoric to the massacre at the Colorado LGBTQ nightclub and detailed their experiences on the night of the shooting, in prepared testimony read before the House Oversight and Reform committee Wednesday.

TITLE: Department of Veterans Affairs sued over decision to offer abortion counseling and certain abortions to veterans
SUMMARY: A nurse at a Department of Veterans Affairs medical facility in Texas sued the department Tuesday over its decision to offer abortions services in certain cases and abortion counseling to veterans, claiming the new rules violate her religious beliefs.

TITLE: DOJ charges 7 with smuggling equipment to Russian military
SUMMARY: The US Justice Department has charged five Russian nationals, one American and an Israeli who is a US permanent resident with allegedly conspiring to violate US sanctions by smuggling US-made equipment to the Russian military, according to a recently unsealed court documents.

TITLE: House to vote on stopgap bill to avert shutdown at end of the week
SUMMARY: The House is expected to vote late on Wednesday to pass a stopgap bill to avert a government shutdown at the end of this week with funding currently set to expire on Friday at midnight.

TITLE: Stephen Miller led-group emerges as top legal foe of Biden initiatives
SUMMARY: A conservative legal group led by former top Trump aide Stephen Miller has emerged as a frequent opponent to several Biden administration initiatives by mounting court challenges, succeeding in blocking policies they say are examples of reverse discrimination.

TITLE: DOJ touts first-of-its-kind settlement in racial discrimination case targeting 'crime-free housing' policy
SUMMARY: The US Justice Department on Wednesday filed what it is describing as a first-of-its-kind settlement in a racial discrimination case challenging a so-called "crime-free housing ordinance."

TITLE: Georgia Secretary of State Raffensperger calls for end of general election runoffs
SUMMARY: Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger has called on state lawmakers to eliminate general election runoffs.

TITLE: Special counsel Smith has subpoenaed officials in all 7 states targeted by Trump allies in 2020 election
SUMMARY: Special counsel Jack Smith has issued a subpoena to local officials in Allegheny County, Pennsylvania, for information related to the 2020 election, a spokesperson for the county told CNN.

TITLE: Ukrainians push for US to support special tribunal to prosecute Russian leadership for crime of aggression
SUMMARY: Ukrainian officials traveled to the United States last week to push for support for the creation of a special tribunal to prosecute top-level Russian officials for the crime of aggression.

TITLE: Biden administration warns of potential influx of migrants immediately after Title 42 ends
SUMMARY: The end of a Trump-era border policy next week will "likely increase migration flows immediately," and migrants who are in encampments along Mexico's northern border may attempt to cross into the United States, according to a Homeland Security intelligence memo reviewed by CNN.

TITLE: White House aide leaving to be communications director for newly established CHIPS program office
SUMMARY: Matt Hill, a longtime communications aide to President Joe Biden, is leaving the White House for the Department of Commerce to steer communications for the implementation of the administration's multi-billion-dollar investment in the semiconductor industry.

TITLE: They say this is good economic news. It might not feel like it
SUMMARY: There's some good news to report, but questions and caveats are looming in the future.

TITLE: Club Q survivors blame GOP rhetoric for mass violence
SUMMARY: Survivors of the Club Q mass shooting directly tied Republicans' rhetoric to the massacre at the Colorado LGBTQ nightclub and detailed their experiences on the night of the shooting, in prepared testimony read before the House Oversight and Reform committee Wednesday.

TITLE: House passes stopgap bill to avert shutdown at end of the week
SUMMARY: The House voted Wednesday evening to pass a stopgap bill to avert a government shutdown at the end of this week with funding currently set to expire on Friday at midnight.

TITLE: Former US ambassadors push for help for Afghan allies in spending bill
SUMMARY: A group of retired ambassadors, all of whom served as chief of mission at the US Embassy in Afghanistan, have written a letter to congressional leaders pushing them to include the Afghan Adjustment Act in the omnibus spending bill.

TITLE: Pelosi attack suspect planned to target Hunter Biden, Gavin Newsom and Tom Hanks, police official says
SUMMARY: The man accused of attacking House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's husband, Paul, said there was "evil in Washington" and had also planned to target President Joe Biden's son Hunter, California Gov. Gavin Newsom and actor Tom Hanks, a San Francisco Police Department official testified Wednesday.

TITLE: Ukrainians push for US to support special tribunal to prosecute Russian leadership for crime of aggression
SUMMARY: Ukrainian officials traveled to the United States last week to push for support for the creation of a special tribunal to prosecute top-level Russian officials for the crime of aggression.

TITLE: Pelosi honored with official portrait and emotional tributes at unveiling ceremony
SUMMARY: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's official portrait was unveiled in a ceremony Wednesday at the US Capitol, with speeches from old allies and political sparring-mates who reminisced on her historic tenure.

TITLE: Man who allegedly threatened to kill Arizona election official facing federal charges
SUMMARY: An Ohio man who allegedly threatened to kill an Arizona state election official during the 2022 midterm election season is now facing federal charges, the Justice Department announced Wednesday.

TITLE: DOJ sues Arizona for placing shipping containers at the border
SUMMARY: The federal government is suing Arizona for placing shipping containers at the border as a temporary wall, according to court documents filed Wednesday.

TITLE: Why voters don't want Biden or Trump but might get them anyway in 2024
SUMMARY: Even as President Joe Biden and ex-President Donald Trump move toward a rerun of the most turbulent White House race in modern history, many voters are pining for a break from the past -- and the present.

TITLE: Jill Biden now 'all in' for second run at the White House, people close to her say
SUMMARY: First lady Jill Biden, despite being so worn out from a recent circuit of White House events that she lost her voice, is now seriously looking ahead to her husband running for reelection in 2024. That's a tidal shift from her position just three months ago.

TITLE: White House warns of possible Covid-19 winter surge: 'This is not one disease in isolation'
SUMMARY: For Americans across the country preparing to gather and socialize with family and friends during the end-of-year holiday season, the White House has a clear warning: Covid-19 is not over, and you had better protect yourself.

TITLE: Stephen Miller-led group emerges as top legal foe of Biden initiatives
SUMMARY: A conservative legal group led by former top Trump aide Stephen Miller has emerged as a frequent opponent to several Biden administration initiatives by mounting court challenges, succeeding in blocking policies they say are examples of reverse discrimination.

TITLE: Floor fights and House speaker elections, explained
SUMMARY: Rep. Kevin McCarthy has a math problem, and he has to solve it by January 3. When the new Congress assembles on that date, it establishes a quorum, and then its first action will be a roll call vote to elect a new speaker. Not until after this election does the House get down to business.

TITLE: House passes bill to replace bust of Roger Taney with one honoring Thurgood Marshall
SUMMARY: The House on Wednesday passed by voice vote a bill that would replace a bust of former Chief Justice Roger Taney, the man who authored the majority opinion in the infamous Dred Scott case, in the Old Supreme Court Chamber of the US Capitol with one of Thurgood Marshall, the first Black Supreme Court justice.

TITLE: Jill Biden makes a tidal shift from her thoughts on another run at the White House
SUMMARY: First lady Jill Biden, despite being so worn out from a recent circuit of White House events that she lost her voice, is now seriously looking ahead to her husband running for reelection in 2024. That's a tidal shift from her position just three months ago.

TITLE: Justice Department charges Washington state man who allegedly threatened members of Congress
SUMMARY: The Justice Department has brought federal charges against a Washington state man who allegedly made multiple threats against members of Congress, using antisemitic slurs and saying he would "murder" lawmakers.

TITLE: Fight for control of the RNC turns heated as some members demand change
SUMMARY: Shortly before announcing her campaign against Republican National Committee chair Ronna McDaniel, Harmeet Dhillon, a well-connected conservative attorney, phoned an important ally to solicit his thoughts.

TITLE: Attorney disciplinary committee says Giuliani violated ethics rules with 2020 election fraud claims
SUMMARY: False election fraud claims that Rudy Giuliani made when he was representing former President Donald Trump's campaign in 2020 should make the former New York mayor liable for professional sanctions, an attorney disciplinary committee said Thursday.

TITLE: Biden and Senate Democrats set to close out historic 2 years in judicial confirmations, pledging more
SUMMARY: Throughout the legislative battles of President Joe Biden's first two years in office, one Democratic priority served as a clear if quiet measure of methodical, consistent accomplishment: the pipeline of judicial confirmations to the federal bench.

TITLE: Biden administration releases plan for the scheduled lifting of Title 42 next week
SUMMARY: The Department of Homeland Security's six-pillar plan for the scheduled end of Title 42 next week includes surging resources to the border, increasing processing efficiency, imposing consequences for unlawful entry, bolstering nonprofit capacity, targeting smugglers and working with international partners.

TITLE: US toughens restrictions on Chinese tech firms linked to military
SUMMARY: The United States added a major Chinese chipmaker and dozens of other Chinese companies to a trade blacklist Thursday as it works to restrict Beijing's high-tech and artificial intelligence industries.

TITLE: Moderate Republicans weigh hardball tactics to counter anti-McCarthy crew
SUMMARY: As frustration inside the House GOP has grown over a small band of anti-Kevin McCarthy lawmakers, an idea to strike back at the rebellious group has been floated among some Republicans: kicking these members off their committees, according to multiple members involved in the conversations.

TITLE: Exclusive: US finalizing plans to send Patriot missile defense system to Ukraine
SUMMARY: The Biden administration is finalizing plans to send the Patriot missile defense system to Ukraine that could be announced as soon as this week, according to two US officials and a senior administration official.

TITLE: New Hampshire Gov. Sununu says 'we're moving on' from Trump
SUMMARY: New Hampshire Gov. Chris Sununu makes one thing clear: His vision for the future of the Republican Party does not include former President Donald Trump.

TITLE: Biden says he'll travel to Africa soon as he announces billions in new commitments
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden hailed cooperation with Africa and said he looked forward to visiting the continent soon as he endeavors to expand ties in a region where China and Russia have been making inroads.

TITLE: Former Twitter employee sentenced to more than three years in prison in Saudi spy case
SUMMARY: A former Twitter manager convicted of spying for Saudi Arabia was sentenced on Wednesday to more than three years in prison.

TITLE: Lawmakers running out of time as defense bill and government funding stopgap stall
SUMMARY: Hill leaders are hoping the Senate will be able to imminently pass a major defense policy bill and a stopgap government funding bill to avert a shutdown at the end of the week -- but timing for final passage of the two measures is unclear as lawmakers attempt to sort out last-minute issues.

TITLE: Schumer and Pelosi say Biden should run in 2024
SUMMARY: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer and outgoing House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, both said President Joe Biden should seek reelection in 2024 after what they described as an "excellent" first two years in office.

TITLE: US intel agencies likely missed chances to investigate Covid pandemic's origin, House Democrats' report says
SUMMARY: Democratic investigators on the House Intelligence Committee have alleged that US intelligence agencies may have lost a critical opportunity to gather useful information on the Covid-19 pandemic's origins by failing to pivot its collection resources earlier. In a report released on Thursday morning, the Democrats also laid out perhaps the most detailed timeline to date of the litany of warnings the intelligence community offered the Trump administration in the early days of the pandemic.

TITLE: 3 militia members sentenced in Whitmer kidnap plot
SUMMARY: Three men were sentenced Thursday for providing material support for a terrorist act and two other state-level charges related to the 2020 plot to kidnap Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer, according to a statement from the Michigan attorney general's office.

TITLE: Senate to vote on defense bill that rescinds military Covid vaccine mandate
SUMMARY: The Senate is expected to vote on Thursday to pass sweeping legislation that would authorize $858 billion in national defense funding and rescind the US military's Covid vaccine mandate.

TITLE: Trump unveils plans to take on tech companies if he wins in 2024 in appeal to conservative base
SUMMARY: Donald Trump vowed Thursday that if he is elected president again, he would ban federal money from being used to label speech as misinformation or disinformation, fire federal officials who have engaged in what he characterized as "domestic censorship," and punish universities engaging in "censorship activities" with cuts to federal funding.

TITLE: John Thune Fast Facts
SUMMARY: Read CNN's Fast Facts on John Thune and learn about the Republican Senator and Senate majority whip from South Dakota.

TITLE: Officer injured on Jan. 6 says resigning wasn't his choice: 'They did that to me, the mob'
SUMMARY: A US Capitol police officer injured on January 6, 2021, said Thursday that he is not leaving the force by choice, but "because they did that to me, the mob."

TITLE: National Archives releases thousands of JFK assassination documents
SUMMARY: The National Archives on Thursday released thousands of previously classified documents collected as part of the government review into the 1963 assassination of President John F. Kennedy.

TITLE: New Hampshire Gov. Sununu says 'we're moving on' from Trump
SUMMARY: New Hampshire Gov. Chris Sununu makes one thing clear: His vision for the future of the Republican Party does not include former President Donald Trump.

TITLE: US Patriots could protect Ukraine's power grid; Russia threatens 'unpredictable consequences'
SUMMARY: Russia's attacks on Ukraine's power grid are targeting the entire population, casting people into darkness and cold, and pushing the US closer to sending the Patriot missile defense system long sought by Ukraine's government.

TITLE: Here's what's in the $858 billion defense bill
SUMMARY: Congress is on its way to passing a bipartisan $858 billion defense bill that would give service members a hefty pay raise, bolster support for Ukraine and Taiwan and rescind the US military's Covid-19 vaccine mandate. Here are some key provisions in the NDAA.

TITLE: Fact check: Republican congressman falsely claims Democratic congresswoman said pedophilia isn't a crime
SUMMARY: On Thursday afternoon, Republican Rep. Ronny Jackson of Texas accused Democratic Rep. Katie Porter of California of having said that "pedophilia isn't a crime."

TITLE: Federal judge says Biden can't yet end Trump-era 'Remain in Mexico' immigration policy
SUMMARY: A federal judge in Texas has put on hold for the Biden administration's most recent attempt to end the so-called "Remain in Mexico" program.

TITLE: Senate passes defense bill that rescinds military Covid vaccine mandate
SUMMARY: The Senate voted on Thursday to pass sweeping legislation that would authorize $858 billion in national defense funding and rescind the US military's Covid vaccine mandate.

TITLE: Senate to vote on stopgap bill to avert shutdown at end of the week
SUMMARY: The Senate is on track to vote Thursday evening to pass a stopgap bill to avert a government shutdown at the end of this week with funding currently set to expire on Friday at midnight.

TITLE: Senate passes stopgap bill to avert shutdown at end of the week
SUMMARY: The Senate voted on Thursday evening to pass a stopgap bill to avert a government shutdown at the end of this week with funding currently set to expire on Friday at midnight.

TITLE: Schumer and Pelosi say Biden should run in 2024
SUMMARY: House Speaker Nancy Pelos is leaving Democratic leadership after Republicans won the majority. Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer is remaining at the helm of a chamber Democrats still control.

TITLE: US toughens restrictions on Chinese tech firms linked to military
SUMMARY: The United States added a major Chinese chipmaker and dozens of other Chinese companies to a trade blacklist Thursday as it works to restrict Beijing's high-tech and artificial intelligence industries.

TITLE: Exclusive: Schumer and Pelosi say Biden should run in 2024
SUMMARY: House Speaker Nancy Pelos is leaving Democratic leadership after Republicans won the majority. Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer is remaining at the helm of a chamber Democrats still control.

TITLE: Everyone can now agree -- the US has a border crisis
SUMMARY: A pointless argument battered Washington for much of this year over whether the southern US border is in crisis. But no one is now doubting the chaos and potential migrant surge that could be triggered by an imminent policy shift next week.

TITLE: White House zeroes in on Republicans to work with as new reality sets in
SUMMARY: Facing a dramatically narrowed path to passing legislation next year, the White House has started to zero in on potential openings that Republicans' precariously slim, four-seat House majority may create.

TITLE: Black voter turnout was down in 2022. Democratic operatives are panicking about what it could mean for 2024
SUMMARY: An informal group of Black elected officials has lit up over phone calls and texts since Election Day. They're worried about Black turnout that continues to underperform and talking ideas about how to turn it around before the next presidential election.

TITLE: New Hampshire Gov. Sununu says Trump is 'not the influence he thinks he is'
SUMMARY: New Hampshire Gov. Chris Sununu said there's an argument to be made that former President Donald Trump is "not the influence he thinks he is" -- or even the frontrunner of the Republican party in 2024.

TITLE: US State Department opens 'China House' to coordinate policy toward Beijing
SUMMARY: The US State Department announced it is opening a "China House" on Friday which will serve as the convening point for US policy toward Beijing and boost the number of diplomats focused on the country.

TITLE: Virginia schools can require masking for peers and teachers of 12 students with disabilities, settlement states
SUMMARY: Virginia schools can require masking for peers and teachers of 12 students with disabilities to protect from virus exposure as part of reasonable accommodations under federal disability law, according to a settlement reached this week.

TITLE: Capitol rioter who chased officer near Senate chamber sentenced to 5 years in prison
SUMMARY: The rioter at the front of a mob that chased US Capitol Police Officer Eugene Goodman up flights of stairs near the Senate chamber on January 6, 2021, has been sentenced to five years behind bars.

TITLE: Federal investigators have accessed emails of Rep. Scott Perry and Trump allies in 2020 efforts
SUMMARY: Among the documents were 331 drafts of an autobiography outline by former Justice Department official Jeffrey Clark

TITLE: Biden signs short-term bill to avert a government shutdown this week
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden signed a one-week stopgap funding bill on Friday to avert a government shutdown, extending the deadline until December 23 to allow congressional negotiators more time to finalize a full-year funding deal.

TITLE: Federal appeals court throws out case brought by Connecticut high school girls challenging trans-inclusive sports policy
SUMMARY: A federal appeals court on Friday threw out a case brought by four cisgender high school girls in Connecticut who claimed the state's trans-inclusive sports policy violated their civil rights and deprived them of a "chance to be champions."

TITLE: Scammers steal hundreds of thousands of dollars in shipments from US food suppliers, FBI warns
SUMMARY: Cybercriminals have in recent months stolen hundreds of thousands of dollars' worth of shipments from US food suppliers by placing fraudulent orders for milk products, the FBI and other federal agencies warned on Friday.

TITLE: Kosovo rebel commander sentenced to 26 years in prison for war crimes in case overseen by the special counsel named in the Trump probes
SUMMARY: A war crimes tribunal in The Hague on Friday sentenced a former commander of the Kosovo Liberation Army to 26 years in prison for the war crimes of arbitrary detention, torture and murder.

TITLE: Key House committee to hold high-stakes meeting on Trump's taxes Tuesday
SUMMARY: The Democratic-controlled House Ways and Means Committee will hold a meeting Tuesday to discuss the contents of former President Donald Trump's tax returns.

TITLE: National Archives releases thousands of JFK assassination documents
SUMMARY: The National Archives on Thursday released thousands of previously classified documents collected as part of the government review into the 1963 assassination of President John F. Kennedy.

TITLE: North Carolina voter ID law had racially discriminatory intent, state Supreme Court says
SUMMARY: The North Carolina Supreme Court on Friday upheld a lower court ruling that struck down the state's 2018 voter ID law, agreeing with the lower court that it had been passed with the intent of targeting Black voters who were unlikely to vote for Republicans.

TITLE: January 6 committee considering asking DOJ to pursue at least two criminal charges against Trump
SUMMARY: The House select committee investigating January 6, 2021, is considering asking the Justice Department to pursue multiple charges against former President Donald Trump, according to a source familiar with the matter.

TITLE: McCarthy says hardliners 'have not moved' in opposition to speaker's bid and could put GOP agenda 'in jeopardy'
SUMMARY: House GOP Leader Kevin McCarthy said Friday that five conservative hardliners have not budged in their opposition to his speaker's bid, offering dire warnings that their hard-fought Republican majority could be derailed if they don't bend.

TITLE: Attorney General Garland instructs prosecutors to end sentencing disparities between crack and powder cocaine
SUMMARY: Attorney General Merrick Garland instructed federal prosecutors Friday to end sentencing disparities between offenders convicted of crimes involving crack and powder cocaine, a decadeslong policy that has led to disproportionate prison sentences for Black Americans compared to Whites.

TITLE: Jeff Sessions Fast Facts
SUMMARY: Read CNN's Fast Facts about former US Attorney General Jeff Sessions.

TITLE: Trump's NFT venture befuddles allies and fuels concerns over direction of 2024 campaign
SUMMARY: Allies of Donald Trump are distancing themselves from his latest business venture, hours after the former president debuted a series of digital trading cards that befuddled and exasperated his own campaign aides and were roundly mocked by some of his most ardent supporters.

TITLE: Dennis Hastert Fast Facts
SUMMARY: Read CNN's Fast Facts about Dennis Hastert, former Republican speaker of the House.

TITLE: Pentagon offers few answers in UFO investigation but has received several hundred more reports
SUMMARY: In the Pentagon's first update since the establishment of its office to investigate unidentified flying objects, officials offered few answers but said there was nothing to suggest an otherworldly explanation for the hundreds of reports they had received.

TITLE: Jan. 6 panel considers asking DOJ to pursue multiple Trump criminal charges
SUMMARY: The House select committee investigating January 6, 2021, is considering asking the Justice Department to pursue at least three criminal charges against former President Donald Trump, according to a source familiar with the matter.

TITLE: January 6 committee expected to announce referral of multiple criminal charges against Trump to DOJ
SUMMARY: The House select committee investigating January 6, 2021, is expected to announce it will refer at least three criminal charges against former President Donald Trump to the Justice Department, including insurrection, obstruction of an official proceeding and conspiracy to defraud the federal government.

TITLE: Appeals court rejects bid to keep Title 42 in force
SUMMARY: A federal appeals court on Friday rejected a bid by several Republican-led states to keep the so-called Title 42 rule in force, after a district court struck the controversial Trump-era border policy down.

TITLE: Joe Kennedy III expected to be named as special envoy to Northern Ireland
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden is expected to name former congressman Joe Kennedy III as his special envoy to Northern Ireland for economic affairs, according to two people familiar with the plans, installing a member of one of the United States' most famous political families to the post at a critical moment for the region.

TITLE: What is Title 42, and what happens now that a federal appeals court has weighed in?
SUMMARY: A federal appeals court ruling means the December 21 deadline for lifting the Trump-era public health restrictions still stands.

TITLE: New Hampshire Gov. Sununu says Trump is 'not the influence he thinks he is'
SUMMARY: New Hampshire Gov. Chris Sununu said there's an argument to be made that former President Donald Trump is "not the influence he thinks he is" -- or even the frontrunner of the Republican party in 2024.

TITLE: January 6 defendant arrested for allegedly planning to kill FBI agents who had investigated him
SUMMARY: A Tennessee man already facing charges in connection with the January 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol was arrested for allegedly planning to kill FBI agents, including those who had been investigating him, the Justice Department announced Friday.

TITLE: Pittsburgh bridge to reopen less than one year after collapse with help from Biden's infrastructure law
SUMMARY: A bridge in Pittsburgh that collapsed in January, hours before President Joe Biden was scheduled to visit the city to tout his landmark infrastructure funding law, is expected to reopen by the end of December.

TITLE: Republicans won the popular vote, but they're not used to this feeling
SUMMARY: The cruel truth of American democracy, usually experienced by Democrats, is that a political party can get more votes than the other without winning much power. This year, however, it's Republicans who got more votes and don't have as much to show for it.

TITLE: Georgia grand jury investigating Trump election interference is winding down and has begun writing final report
SUMMARY: A special grand jury investigating efforts by former President Donald Trump and his allies to overturn the 2020 election in Georgia is winding down its work, according to sources familiar with the matter.

TITLE: First on CNN: Retired top military officials push for bill to help Afghans
SUMMARY: Roughly two dozen former leaders of the US military -- including retired chairmen of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, a former Supreme Allied commander of NATO and several former commanders in Afghanistan -- sent a letter to US congressional leaders Saturday evening urging them to act quickly to save Afghan allies who currently run the risk of deportation.

TITLE: Trump calls on his supporters to stand down on McCarthy opposition
SUMMARY: Donald Trump has weighed in on the contentious battle confronting GOP leader Kevin McCarthy in his bid to be the chamber's next speaker, with the former president calling on his supporters in Congress to halt their opposition tactics against McCarthy and stop "playing a very dangerous game."

TITLE: 'Election marshals' and runoff rules: States eye a new round of voting changes ahead of 2024
SUMMARY: Two years after the 2020 election and the pandemic put a spotlight on how elections are run, legislators around the country are signaling they aren't finished yet with big changes to election administration and could implement new rules ahead of the 2024 presidential election.

TITLE: GOP congressman signals confidence in McCarthy capturing speakership: 'We will get there'
SUMMARY: A Republican lawmaker on Sunday signaled confidence in House GOP leader Kevin McCarthy's ability to capture the speakership and move forward even as a number of conservative hard-liners are threatening to upend his bid.

TITLE: Retiring GOP senator says Trump's influence on party is 'waning'
SUMMARY: Retiring Pennsylvania Sen. Pat Toomey offered a pointed closing message for his fellow Republican colleagues on Sunday, saying that former President Donald Trump's hold on the party is "waning"

TITLE: Arkansas GOP governor will make 2024 presidential decision 'the first part of next year'
SUMMARY: Arkansas Republican Gov. Asa Hutchinson says he will decide in "the first part of next year" if he wants to mount a campaign for president in 2024.

TITLE: January 6 committee considering how to handle uncooperative GOP lawmakers, Schiff says
SUMMARY: Rep. Adam Schiff, a member of the House select committee investigating the January 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol, said Sunday the panel is considering how to hold accountable the GOP lawmakers who defied their subpoenas.

TITLE: How the midterms changed the 2024 primaries for Biden and Trump
SUMMARY: Much of the conversation in the leadup to the midterms revolved around how Republicans were clamoring for former President Donald Trump's endorsement, while Democrats wanted President Joe Biden to stay away. A little over a month after the election, however, the picture looks quite different.

TITLE: Manchin says Biden should ask for extension of Trump-era border policy
SUMMARY: Democratic Sen. Joe Manchin said Sunday that President Joe Biden should ask for an extension of Title 42, a public health authority that was invoked under former President Donald Trump and allows officials to expel migrants encountered at the US-Mexico border.

TITLE: Here's what to know about criminal referrals the January 6 committee may make
SUMMARY: The House select committee investigating the January 6, 2021, insurrection is set to make announcements at its final public meeting on Monday about criminal referrals to the Justice Department.

TITLE: Biden to name former Rep. Joe Kennedy III as Northern Ireland envoy Monday morning
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden will announce Monday morning that former Massachusetts Rep. Joe Kennedy III will serve as the US envoy to Northern Ireland, according to a source with knowledge.

TITLE: New Hampshire Gov. Sununu says Trump is 'not the influence he thinks he is'
SUMMARY: New Hampshire Gov. Chris Sununu said there's an argument to be made that former President Donald Trump is "not the influence he thinks he is" -- or even the front-runner for the 2024 Republican presidential nomination.

TITLE: Attorney General Garland condemns 'rise in antisemitism' at National Menorah lighting ceremony
SUMMARY: Attorney General Merrick Garland spoke out against antisemitism at Sunday night's National Menorah lighting.

TITLE: January 6 committee expected to wrap up its work with a historic call for Trump's accountability
SUMMARY: The expected move by the January 6 committee to formally ask the Department of Justice to prosecute former President Donald Trump over his role in the US Capitol insurrection will make history, whether or not charges are ever brought.

TITLE: A guide to the January 6 committee's big week
SUMMARY: Nearly two years removed from the violent attack on the US Capitol, the House select committee tasked with finding out exactly what happened is about to show its hand.

TITLE: First on CNN: Biden administration moves to phase out compact fluorescent light bulbs and push market toward LEDs
SUMMARY: A new Biden rule would effectively phase out compact fluorescent light bulbs and move the US light bulb markets decisively to more energy-efficient LEDs.

TITLE: Trial begins for Proud Boys leaders charged with seditious conspiracy
SUMMARY: Leaders of the right-wing extremist Proud Boys will face trial starting Monday for their alleged conspiracy to stop Joe Biden from assuming the presidency, another test for the Justice Department's effort to punish the far-right political movement connected to fierce allies of former President Donald Trump.

TITLE: What to watch for during the January 6 committee's final session
SUMMARY: The House select committee investigating the US Capitol attack on January 6, 2021, will hold its last public meeting on Monday, marking the end of an expansive investigation that has spanned more than 17 months, encompassed more than 1,000 interviews and culminated in accusations that former President Donald Trump and his closest allies sought to overthrow the 2020 presidential election and stop the peaceful transfer of power.

TITLE: Jan. 6 committee to vote on criminal referrals in final public meeting
SUMMARY: The House select committee investigating the Jan. 6 insurrection at the US Capitol is holding its last public session on Monday. Watch live and follow the latest news updates here.

TITLE: How to watch Monday's January 6 committee meeting
SUMMARY: The House select committee investigating the January 6, 2021, insurrection will hold its final public meeting on Monday, when it's expected to announce criminal referrals to the Justice Department.

TITLE: White House pushes back on calls to extend Title 42: 'We have to follow the court order'
SUMMARY: The White House is pushing back on calls for the administration to find a way to extend a controversial public health authority that has been used to swiftly expel migrants at the US-Mexico border.

TITLE: Biden administration marks Hanukkah with denunciation of antisemitism
SUMMARY: The Biden administration is marking the celebration of Hanukkah this year by publicly denouncing antisemitism in the United States, with Attorney General Merrick Garland, a Jew, calling for Americans to unite against "bigotry in any of its forms."

TITLE: First on CNN: Top Biden adviser's end-of-year memo celebrates president's 'strong jolt of momentum' heading into 2023
SUMMARY: As 2022 comes to a close, President Joe Biden's top adviser Mike Donilon has a rosy outlook on the president's political durability: Biden heads into the new year with a "strong jolt of momentum," he says.

TITLE: Incoming House GOP chairs ratchet up pressure on McCarthy's detractors and call on them to not 'squander' their majority
SUMMARY: Republicans who will chair House committees in the next Congress are warning that if Kevin McCarthy's detractors deny him the 218 votes needed to become speaker, they are at risk of undermining the slim majority they won in November.

TITLE: Incoming New York congressman may have misrepresented parts of his resume, New York Times reports
SUMMARY: Incoming Republican congressman George Santos may have misrepresented parts of his resume, a report in The New York Times finds.

TITLE: Appeals court rejects bid to keep Title 42 in force
SUMMARY: A federal appeals court on Friday rejected a bid by several Republican-led states to keep the so-called Title 42 rule in force, after a district court struck the controversial Trump-era border policy down.

TITLE: Read: Summary of House January 6 committee's investigation
SUMMARY: The House committee investigating the January 6, 2021, insurrection at the US Capitol held its final public session on Monday, marking the end of the panel's expansive probe into the riot and former President Donald Trump's role in it. The committee is expected to release its final report in full later this week, but first released a summary of its key findings.

TITLE: What's in the House January 6 committee report summary
SUMMARY: The House select committee investigating the January 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol has concluded that former President Donald Trump was ultimately responsible for the insurrection, laying out for the public and the Justice Department a trove of evidence for why he should be prosecuted for multiple crimes.

TITLE: Iran and Russia were too distracted to meddle in midterm elections, US general says
SUMMARY: Domestic unrest in Iran and Russia's war in Ukraine may have distracted Tehran and Moscow from making more of an effort to influence or interfere in the 2022 US midterm election, a top US military cyberofficial said Monday.

TITLE: Biden administration finalizing its plans as it braces for end of Title 42
SUMMARY: The Biden administration is finalizing its plans, including a controversial asylum policy, ahead of the end of a Trump-era border restriction that's set to expire in just days, according to officials familiar with the planning.

TITLE: Takeaways from Monday's Jan. 6 committee meeting
SUMMARY: The January 6 committee used its final public meeting Monday to summarize its 17-month investigation with a simple closing statement: All roads lead to Donald Trump.

TITLE: Incoming Republican congressman George Santos under scrutiny for resume discrepancies
SUMMARY: Republican Rep.-elect George Santos may have misrepresented parts of his resume, a CNN review of his public statements confirms.

TITLE: Justice Department warns of dramatic increase in 'sextortion' schemes targeting boys
SUMMARY: At least 3,000 minors, mostly boys, have been targeted by financial "sextortion" schemes this year, a dramatic increase from previous years, the Justice Department announced in a public safety alert on Monday.

The House select committee investigating the January 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol held its last public meeting on Monday, laying out its findings, approving its final report and outlining criminal referrals for former President Donald Trump and other officials.

A new video clip played by the House select committee investigating the January 6 insurrection of the US Capitol shows Hope Hicks, who previously served as a top aide to former President Donald Trump, reference Trump's baseless claims of election fraud.

TITLE: GOP-led states ask Supreme Court to allow Title 42 to remain in place
SUMMARY: A group of GOP-led states raced to the Supreme Court on Monday in an emergency bid to keep in place a Trump-era immigration policy known as Title 42 that is set to go off the books Wednesday.

Former Deputy FBI Director Andrew McCabe explains how the Department of Justice is receiving the criminal referral of former President Donald Trump by the House select committee investigating the January 6 insurrection of the US capitol.

TITLE: Jan. 6 committee votes to refer Trump to DOJ on multiple criminal charges
SUMMARY: The Jan. 6 committee voted to approve its final report and the referral of multiple criminal charges against former President Donald Trump to the DOJ during the panel's final public meeting Monday. Watch live and follow the latest news updates here.

TITLE: Lawmakers to push through first legislative response to Jan. 6 Capitol attack by week's end
SUMMARY: Lawmakers reached an agreement to include in must-pass legislation a measure aimed at making it harder to overturn a certified presidential election, marking the first legislative response to the US Capitol insurrection and then-President Donald Trump's relentless pressure campaign to stay in power despite his 2020 loss.

TITLE: Chief Justice John Roberts temporarily freezes order meant to end Title 42 Wednesday
SUMMARY: Supreme Court Chief Justice John Roberts on Monday put a temporary hold on the termination of a controversial Trump-era immigration policy known as Title 42 that was set to end on December 21, leaving it in place for now.

TITLE: Incoming Republican congressman George Santos under scrutiny for resume discrepancies
SUMMARY: Republican Rep.-elect George Santos may have misrepresented parts of his resume, a CNN review of his public statements confirms.

TITLE: Biden administration finalizing its plans as it braces for end of Title 42 and a rush at the border
SUMMARY: The Biden administration is finalizing its response to Wednesday's anticipated end of a Trump-era border restriction known as Title 42, according to officials familiar with the planning.

TITLE: Title 42 to remain in place for now as Chief Justice Roberts temporarily freezes order meant to end it
SUMMARY: Supreme Court Chief Justice John Roberts on Monday put a temporary hold on the termination of a controversial Trump-era immigration policy known as Title 42 that was set to end on December 21, leaving it in place for now.

TITLE: Afghan Adjustment Act not included in omnibus spending bill, source says
SUMMARY: The Afghan Adjustment Act will not be included in the omnibus spending bill, a source familiar told CNN.

TITLE: GOP hardliners ratchet up demands amid calls for unity behind McCarthy's speakership bid
SUMMARY: The GOP fight for House speaker intensified on Monday with a group of incoming chairmen demanding that their party fall in line behind House GOP Leader Kevin McCarthy -- and his conservative critics pushing back.

TITLE: Biden administration marks Hanukkah with denunciation of antisemitism
SUMMARY: The Biden administration is marking the celebration of Hanukkah this year by publicly denouncing antisemitism in the United States, with Attorney General Merrick Garland, a Jew, calling for Americans to unite against "bigotry in any of its forms."

TITLE: Maricopa judge allows narrow part of Kari Lake's Arizona election lawsuit to head to trial
SUMMARY: A Maricopa County Superior Court judge ruled Monday that Arizona Republican Kari Lake, who lost last month's gubernatorial race, will be allowed to head to trial on two narrow claims in an election lawsuit.

TITLE: The 5 'known unknowns' that will define 2024
SUMMARY: The powerful evidence for a possible criminal case that the bipartisan January 6, 2021, congressional committee presented against former President Donald Trump on Monday underscores the biggest uncertainty looming over the approaching 2024 presidential campaign.

TITLE: The fateful question the January 6 committee left hanging over the United States
SUMMARY: With its mic drop finale, the House committee investigating the US Capitol insurrection left a fateful question hanging over Washington, Donald Trump and the 2024 presidential campaign: will the ex-president be charged with a crime?

TITLE: Lawmakers unveil sweeping government funding bill to avert shutdown
SUMMARY: Lawmakers early Tuesday unveiled legislative text of a massive full-year government funding bill that Congress hopes to pass to avert a shutdown at the end of the week.

TITLE: Jan. 6 committee votes to refer Trump to DOJ on multiple criminal charges
SUMMARY: The Jan. 6 committee voted to approve its final report and the referral of multiple criminal charges against former President Donald Trump to the DOJ during the panel's final public meeting Monday. Watch live and follow the latest news updates here.

TITLE: Virginia Democrats to hold 'firehouse' primary ahead of special House election
SUMMARY: Virginia Democrats will choose a nominee on Tuesday for the special election to fill the term of the late Rep. Donald McEachin, who died in November just weeks after winning reelection.

TITLE: Analysis: The 5 'known unknowns' that will define 2024
SUMMARY: The powerful evidence for a possible criminal case that the bipartisan January 6, 2021, congressional committee presented against former President Donald Trump on Monday underscores the biggest uncertainty looming over the approaching 2024 presidential campaign.

TITLE: House Ways and Means Committee to meet on future of Trump's tax returns
SUMMARY: The House Ways and Means Committee will meet Tuesday to discuss former President Donald Trump's tax returns and weigh whether to release the information to the public, the end to a years-long effort from Democrats to learn more about Trump's financial background.

TITLE: Takeaways from Monday's Jan. 6 committee meeting
SUMMARY: The January 6 committee used its final public meeting Monday to summarize its 17-month investigation with a simple closing statement: All roads lead to Donald Trump.

TITLE: Uncovering the Veterans Affairs scandal, CNN's Drew Griffin helped ordinary people find the courage to right wrongs
SUMMARY: In 2014, Drew Griffin, our beloved CNN colleague who passed away this weekend, met with arguably the most important source for one of his most groundbreaking stories in a seedy bar in Phoenix.

TITLE: US to send precision bomb kits and Patriot missiles in next Ukraine aid package, officials say
SUMMARY: The US is expected to send Ukraine precision bomb kits that will turn existing unguided munitions, or "dumb" bombs, into precision-guided "smart" bombs known as Joint Direct Attack Munitions, or JDAMs, according to multiple US officials.

TITLE: Virginia state Sen. Jennifer McClellan could make history in special election to fill the late Rep. Donald McEachin's seat
SUMMARY: Virginia Democrats will choose a nominee on Tuesday for the special election to fill the term of the late Rep. Donald McEachin, who died in November just weeks after winning reelection.

TITLE: What is Title 42, and what happens now that the Supreme Court has stepped in?
SUMMARY: An order from Supreme Court Chief Justice John Roberts keeps Title 42 in place for now. But there are still a lot of questions about what's next.

TITLE: Biden administration gears up for end of Trump-era border restriction as Supreme Court considers whether to keep it in place
SUMMARY: The Biden administration is still bracing for the end of a Trump-era border restriction even after the chief justice of the Supreme Court temporarily paused the end of the program.

TITLE: Lawmakers unveil sweeping $1.7 trillion government funding bill to avert shutdown
SUMMARY: Senior lawmakers in both parties early Tuesday unveiled their long-awaited $1.7 trillion government funding package, a move that leaves Congress with little time to review a massive bill before they are forced to cast a vote to approve it or risk a government shutdown.

TITLE: Iran and Russia were too distracted to meddle in midterm elections, US general says
SUMMARY: Domestic unrest in Iran and Russia's war in Ukraine may have distracted Tehran and Moscow from making more of an effort to influence or interfere in the 2022 US midterm election, a top US military cyberofficial said Monday.

TITLE: Jeffries to appoint DelBene to chair Democrats' House campaign operation
SUMMARY: Incoming Democratic leader Hakeem Jeffries is set to appoint Rep. Suzan DelBene of Washington to lead the Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee, sources tell CNN.

TITLE: First on CNN: Treasury Department to roll out new policy to make global humanitarian support easier
SUMMARY: With humanitarian and food crises growing more dire around the world, the Biden administration plans to roll out new steps on Tuesday to make it easier for humanitarian assistance to continue flowing without concerns about US sanctions, according to senior Treasury officials.

TITLE: 3 suicides in 1 week on same aircraft carrier were unrelated, Navy investigation finds
SUMMARY: A US Navy investigation found that three suicides within one week in April among the crew of an aircraft carrier in Newport News, Virginia, were "not related or connected."

TITLE: Here's what's in the $1.7 trillion federal spending bill
SUMMARY: Senate leaders unveiled a $1.7 trillion year-long federal government funding bill early Tuesday morning.

TITLE: Appeals court asks DOJ to weigh in on whether Trump is immune in civil January 6 lawsuits
SUMMARY: The Justice Department is investigating Donald Trump. It also has to decide if it will defend him from lawsuits.

TITLE: First on CNN: 2 Americans held by the Taliban have been released, sources tell CNN
SUMMARY: Two Americans who had been detained by the Taliban in Afghanistan have been released and are en route to Qatar, three sources familiar with the matter tell CNN.

TITLE: US Postal Service fulfills top Biden climate goal with deployment of 66,000 electric delivery trucks
SUMMARY: The US Postal Service on Tuesday announced its intention to deploy at least 66,000 electric delivery trucks by 2028, satisfying a key goal for the Biden administration's climate agenda.
